Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the statement made by Planned Parenthood by implying that they defended Bill Cosby after his conviction, when in reality it was a satirical article published by Babylon Bee.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Planned Parenthood issued a statement in defense of Bill Cosby. The only source provided is a satirical article from Babylon Bee.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Planned Parenthood defended Bill Cosby based on a satirical article, without considering the credibility or intention of the source.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Bill Cosby was convicted of felony sexual assault, while implying that Planned Parenthood defended him.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that the satirical article from Babylon Bee was misinterpreted or taken out of context, leading to the claim that Planned Parenthood defended Bill Cosby.
